clinical_study.brief_title: The Steno Tech Survey: A Study of Insulin Pump Users With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: The Steno Tech Survey: A Multisite Exploratory Study of People With Type 1 Diabetes on Insulin Pump Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This survey study seeks to contribute with new knowledge about the variation in clinical and psychosocial outcomes of people with Type 1 diabetes on insulin pump therapy. Potential sources of variation that are investigated in this study include both individual characteristics, such as demographics and socioeconomic status, and behavioral factors, such as psychological and preference structures. The study is conducted at two hospital sites in Denmark.

arm_group.description: This cohort is expected to consist of 1,400 people with Type 1 diabetes on insulin pump therapy treated at either Steno Diabetes Center Copenhagen or Nordsjællands Hospital Hilleroed.

intervention.description: Two survey questionnaires (T1 and T2). Each questionnaire is composed of multiple items including pre-coded (multiple choice) questions, dichotomous (yes/no) questions, rating scales and validated questionnaire scales to measure general and diabetes/insulin pump-specific behavior, psychosocial/psychological concepts and preferences.

study_pop.textblock: The study population consists of adults (18+) with Type 1 diabetes on insulin pump therapy treated at either Steno Diabetes Center Copenhagen or Nordsjaellands Hospital (approximately 1,400 people).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria (for surveyed group):
- Adult (18+ years)
- Type 1 diabetes
- Insulin pump user
- Danish-speaking
Exclusion criteria (for surveyed group):
- Child ([0;18[ years)
- No access to Danish digital mail (e-Boks)
- Non-Danish speaking
